abstract: About 80 percent of prescriptions for nitroglycerin are filled with unapproved, unvetted tablets, the agency said.
snippet: About 80 percent of prescriptions for nitroglycerin are filled with unapproved, unvetted tablets, the agency said.
lead_paragraph: Doctors in the United States wrote more than four million prescriptions last year for nitroglycerin tablets, heart drugs placed under the tongue to reduce the chest pain angina or to stop a heart attack.

headline.main: F.D.A. Says Millions Got Unapproved Heart Pills
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Says Millions Got Unapproved Heart Pills
